intro: Stadtmannia acuminata, commonly known as the slender-stemmed starflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other showy flowering plants such as the evening primrose. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
